agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH - WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN
service_description:
Provides nutrition education and food vouchers to WIC benefit recipients and qualifying seniors through the WIC Farmers' Market Nutrition Program (FMNP) and Senior Farmers' Market Nutrition Program (SFMNP).

Vouchers may be used to purchase fresh, locally grown, unprocessed fruits, vegetables, and edible herbs from approved farmers' markets and farm stands throughout the state.
site_details:
? To apply for FMNP: Contact your local WIC office; visit https://bit.ly/WIC-FMNP22_Sites for contact information.

? To apply for SFMNP: Contact your local Area Agency on Aging; visit https://bit.ly/S-FMNP22_Sites for contact information.

? Visit the website for additional program information; a list of approved markets and stands may be found at https://bit.ly/WIC-S-FMNP22.
site_schedule:
○ Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm
○ Website: Daily 24 hours
○ Participating market and stand site hours vary.
site_eligibility:
○ For FMNP: Current recipient of WIC benefits -- With gross household income at or below 185% of Federal Poverty Level

○ For SFMNP: Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older with a disability and living in housing occupied primarily by older individuals where congregate nutrition services are provided -- With gross household income at or below 185% of Federal Poverty Level

○ For FMNP: Current recipient of WIC benefits -- With gross household income at or below 185% of Federal Poverty Level

○ For SFMNP: Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older with a disability and living in housing occupied primarily by older individuals where congregate nutrition services are provided -- With gross household income at or below 185% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
service_description: Partners with local health care providers to offer free vaccine clinics to bring children up-to-date on required immunizations for the 2023-2024 school year. There are dozens of clinic sites around the state, and many allow walk-ins.
site_details:
? To find a local clinic site: Visit the website and select your county and desired location from the interactive map menu. -OR- Call the Immunization Division for assistance.

? To see the current list of all required and recommended school immunizations: Visit https://bit.ly/B2S_2022-2023.
site_eligibility: Children age 5 or older

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
service_description: Provides a website for Hoosiers to access immunization records for themselves and their children. Records that have been entered in the state's Children and Hoosiers Immunization Registry Program (CHIRP) can be downloaded, faxed, or printed and used as official proof of immunization for school, travel, or other purposes. Individuals should contact their health care provider or other registered CHIRP provider to request a personal identification number (PIN), which is required to obtain the information.
site_details: Obtain a personal identification number (PIN) from your medical provider, local health department, school, or other CHIRP provider. -- Visit the website and click "Find My Record" from the menu bar. -- 3. Enter required information, including PIN, and click "Get MyVaxIndiana." -- 4. Requested records can be printed, downloaded, or sent by fax. ***For assistance with any step of this process, contact the Help Desk.***
site_schedule: Website: Daily 24 hours -- Help Desk: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm
site_eligibility: Persons with immunization records stored in the Indiana Children and Hoosiers Immunization Registry Program (CHIRP); participating providers listed on website -- Persons accessing their own records or records of their legal dependents

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
service_description: Provides information about immunizations required to attend Indiana schools and answers immunization-related questions. Persons are encouraged to contact their county health department first, and call this line only if they still need assistance.
site_details: If immunization questions cannot be answered by the county health department or by visiting this website, call this number for assistance.
site_eligibility: Individuals needing Indiana immunization requirements for school, referral to providers, or a record for immunizations given and recorded in Indiana

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH - TOBACCO PREVENTION & CESSATION
service_description: Offers a free, phone-based coaching service to help Indiana smokers quit. Services include one-on-one coaching, resources for health care providers, best practices for employers, support for family and friends of smokers, and tools for tobacco control partners. Free nicotine patches or gum may be available for eligible callers, based on phone assessment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to join; information also available online.
site_eligibility: Tobacco users -- For phone and web-based services: Open -- For free patches/gum: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A state library that curates and preserves all types of information and data about the state of Indiana.
service_description: Allows anyone with a valid Indiana public library card to purchase a Public Library Access Card (PLAC) to borrow books from any public library in Indiana. Nonbook materials, such as DVDs and eBooks, may be included at the discretion of the individual libraries.
site_details: Call or walk in to a local public library for information or to apply for a PLAC.
site_eligibility: Have a valid Indiana public library card

agency_desc: A state library that curates and preserves all types of information and data about the state of Indiana.
service_description: Maintains special reference and loan collections pertaining to Indiana history and genealogy. Offers reading materials, films, microfilms, and tapes.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services: Open -- To check out materials: State issued photo ID -- Proof of address if different from ID

agency_desc: A state library that curates and preserves all types of information and data about the state of Indiana.
site_name: INDIANA TALKING BOOK AND BRAILLE LIBRARY
service_description: Lends books and magazines in Braille, in large print, and audio books (along with the machine needed to play audio books) to any Indiana resident who cannot use standard print materials because of a visual or physical disability. Materials are distributed and returned by mail at no charge to the patron.
site_details: Call for more information; walk in or visit the website to print an application.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Unable to read standard print materials due to certified vision loss, dyslexia, or a physical disability (including reading disabilities)

agency_desc: A state library that curates and preserves all types of information and data about the state of Indiana.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Provides a limited criminal history that contains only felonies and Class A misdemeanor arrests within the state of Indiana. Completeness of this information is based upon county participation. As an alternative to performing a search online, a report can also be obtained by mailing a request form to the Indiana State Police.
site_details: Perform search online and print official results, call to have form mailed, or print form and return by mail.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_name: INDIANA CLEARINGHOUSE FOR INFORMATION ON MISSING CHILDREN AND MISSING ENDANGERED ADULTS
service_description: Provides information about missing children and endangered adults and investigates leads on missing children and endangered adults within the state of Indiana.
site_details: Call with information about missing children or endangered adults, or visit website to view missing children bulletins.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.

service_description: Offers an automated tip line for reporting leads about drug, gang, and auto-theft crimes in the state of Indiana.
site_details: Call the tip line and leave specific information about the suspected criminal activity. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_name: IF YOU SEE SOMETHING, SAY SOMETHING!
service_description: Provides a tip line for reporting information or observations that may indicate criminal or terrorist activity. Accepts reports of suspicious behavior by individuals, as well as unusual or out-of-place packages, devices, smells, and so on. Calls are answered by a live operator. In emergency situations, call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call to make a report. Provide as much descriptive information as possible, including what, where, when, and who (gender, age, clothing, etc.).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Provides an opportunity to see a variety of Indiana State Police vehicles, firearms, antique law enforcement equipment, photographs, and confiscated items from the John Dillinger era.
site_details: Walk in. To schedule a tour for groups of ten or more, call a least one day in advance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Gibson, Knox, Pike, Posey, Vanderburgh, and Warrick County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Shelby, Johnson, and Marion County.

agency_desc: The Indiana Supreme Court has discretionary jurisdiction over cases appealed from the Indiana Court of Appeals as well as mandatory jurisdiction over cases involving sentences of death or life in prison. The Supreme Court also administers the state Disciplinary Commission, Commission on Judicial Qualifications, Office of the Clerk of the Appellate Courts, law library.
service_description: Serves as the highest state court in Indiana. This court does not conduct trials. Its primary role is to hear appeals of lower court decisions. This court also determines qualifications and oversees the conduct of lawyers and judges in Indiana.
site_details: Call for information about the Indiana Supreme Court. -- Individual members of the Indiana Supreme Court may be contacted by US mail at the above address. -- Contact the Clerk of the Appellate Courts to begin the filing process.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: The Indiana Supreme Court has discretionary jurisdiction over cases appealed from the Indiana Court of Appeals as well as mandatory jurisdiction over cases involving sentences of death or life in prison. The Supreme Court also administers the state Disciplinary Commission, Commission on Judicial Qualifications, Office of the Clerk of the Appellate Courts, law library.
service_description: Investigates and prosecutes claims of misconduct against lawyers licensed to practice law in Indiana; does not have the authority to order client compensation.
site_details: Call to make a complaint or for more information. Complaint forms may be downloaded and printed from website.
site_eligibility: Open to anyone with a complaint against a lawyer practicing in Indiana

agency_desc: The Indiana Supreme Court has discretionary jurisdiction over cases appealed from the Indiana Court of Appeals as well as mandatory jurisdiction over cases involving sentences of death or life in prison. The Supreme Court also administers the state Disciplinary Commission, Commission on Judicial Qualifications, Office of the Clerk of the Appellate Courts, law library.
service_description: Investigates complaints of judicial ethical misconduct, prosecutes violations when warranted, and advises judges and judicial candidates about their ethical obligations. This agency does not review disputes about the merits of a judge's decision and cannot give advice about whether to appeal a decision. Persons wanting to dispute a judge's decision should immediately seek advice from a lawyer.
site_details: Judicial complaints must be made in writing (form available online for download) and signed under oath. Persons filing complaints should be prepared to provide: A concise but detailed explanation of the judge's allegedly unethical conduct -- Dates, names, and contact information for any witnesses -- Copies of pertinent documents The judge named in the complaint will receive a copy of the complaint.
site_eligibility: Open (complaints against Indiana judges only)

agency_desc: The Indiana Supreme Court has discretionary jurisdiction over cases appealed from the Indiana Court of Appeals as well as mandatory jurisdiction over cases involving sentences of death or life in prison. The Supreme Court also administers the state Disciplinary Commission, Commission on Judicial Qualifications, Office of the Clerk of the Appellate Courts, law library.
service_description: Serves as the primary law library for many state agencies, the Office of the Governor, the legislature, members of the private bar, and the citizens of Indiana. The library offers a tool for the public to conduct their own research without going to the library in person
site_details: Visit website to request access to online resources or to schedule an in person appointment.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-3pm by appointment -- Website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The Indiana Supreme Court has discretionary jurisdiction over cases appealed from the Indiana Court of Appeals as well as mandatory jurisdiction over cases involving sentences of death or life in prison. site_name: INDIANA CLERK OF THE APPELLATE COURTS
service_description: Processes documents filed in appeals from rulings in Indianas trial courts and administrative agencies; collects all associated filing fees; and issues orders and opinions of the Supreme Court, Court of Appeals, and Tax Court.
site_details: Call for court information, filing instructions, and updates on pending matters.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A school that provides low-cost dental services by students under supervision of licensed dentists.
service_description: Offers a wide range of adult and pediatric dental services performed by pre-doctoral and graduate students. Fees are fixed, but are generally less than in the private sector. Full payment is due at time of service. Payment options are available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A school that provides low-cost dental services by students under supervision of licensed dentists.
service_description: Offers emergency dental care for persons who are experiencing pain, swelling, or urgent dental problems.
site_details: Walk in; first come, first served. (Validates parking stubs from Vermont Street garage)
site_eligibility: Experiencing dental pain

agency_desc: A government agency that regulates public utility rates and practices in the state of Indiana.
service_description: Accepts complaints against utility companies and attempts to resolve the issue. Before contacting this agency, consumers should try to resolve the issue with their utility company, ideally by submitting complaints to the utility company and requesting an investigation and written response. If the response is unsatisfactory, customers may contact this agency. While the Consumer Affairs complaint is pending, consumers must continue to pay subsequent utility bills, but not the disputed charge.
site_details: To submit complaints: Walk in, call, fax, mail, or submit via the website.
site_eligibility: Indiana utility consumers (electric, natural gas, water, sewer, telecommunications, video) -- Have attempted to resolve the dispute directly with the utility company

agency_desc: A local membership organization for legal professionals that also sponsors a variety of legal assistance events free for eligible persons.
service_description: Provides free legal advice to callers on the second Tuesday of every month, except December. Callers may ask for information on a variety of legal issues, including divorce, child support, tenant/landlord issues, consumer rights, real estate, and employment issues.

agency_desc: An Indianapolis city government department whose mission is to "connect communities by providing places and experiences that inspire healthy living, social engagement, and a love of nature."
service_description: Provides free weekday meals to children (age 18 and under) in need at a variety of set and mobile sites after school and throughout the summer within the Indianapolis area. Carry-out is not available; food must be eaten on site.

site_schedule: Meals: Mon-Fri; see website for details. -- Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Living in Marion County -- Age 18 or under

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Indianapolis.
service_description: Provides smoke alarms free of charge to low-income homeowners in Indianapolis, when funds are available. One smoke alarm per household. Installation is available free to seniors and others who are unable to install them. (Landlords are responsible for the purchase and installation of smoke alarms in rental properties.)
site_details: Visit the website and fill out the Smoke Alarm Request Form -OR- Call the IFD Smoke Alarm Hotline for an eligibility assessment; leave voicemail with name, address, the number of levels in home (including basement). -- Will receive call back to schedule.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Indianapolis EXCEPT the cities of Lawrence, Beech Grove, and Speedway, and the townships of Pike, Wayne, and Decatur in Indianapolis -- Owner and occupant of the home -- Unable to afford smoke detector for home

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Indianapolis.
service_description: Enforces fire codes, conducts inspections of commercial and public buildings, and promotes public education around fire prevention and response. This department also provides training for employees and residents of nursing homes, as well as any commercial business that requests fire safety training for its employees.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by program

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Indianapolis.
service_description: Provides age-appropriate education to children who have a history of setting or misusing fires or have shown risk factors for setting fires. Families may be referred to other agencies for additional counseling to stop fire-setting activities. Children may be referred by partner agencies or by concerned parents.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; children must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.
site_eligibility: Age 2-18 years-old -- With a history of setting fires, playing with fire, or in need of education/counseling on fire safety

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Indianapolis.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in Marion County EXCEPT the cities of Lawrence and Speedway, and Pike, Wayne, and Decatur townships in Indianapolis

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Indianapolis.
service_description: Provides educational programs to teach children about fire safety. Topics include how to escape fires safely, becoming familiar with firefighters and firefighting equipment, and dialing 9-1-1 in emergency situations.
site_details: Call to schedule a class; an email address must be provided so that a consent packet can be sent.
site_eligibility: Children, ages 5-12 years-old -- Groups of 10-50 children with at least 1 adult per 20 children

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to ensuring that qualified low income persons living in the central Indiana community have access to quality legal assistance for civil disputes.
service_description: Offers free legal consultation and representation to persons with low-income. Accepts only civil and family law cases including adoption, paternity, visitation, guardianship, support, custody, and divorce. This agency does not accept criminal or money-generating cases.
site_details: Call for an appointment. (No criminal or money-generating cases accepted.)
site_eligibility: With household income at or below 125% Federal Poverty Level -- Seeking assistance for a civil or family legal matter

service_description: Offers a mortgage loan to eligible homeowners with disabilities for modifications needed to make the home accessible. NO monthly payment is required; the loan is paid when the home is sold. Improvements may include wheelchair ramps and grab bars.

Also provides low-cost mortgage loans and down payment assistance to low- to moderate-income buyers who qualify. Offers support on the mortgage loan process before and after the purchase.
site_details: Visit the website to complete a registration form or call for assistance.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, Thurs, Fri 8am-5pm; Tues 9am-6pm; by appointment
site_eligibility: Varies by program; call for details.

service_description: Offers a mortgage loan to eligible homeowners with disabilities for modifications needed to make the home accessible. NO monthly payment is required; the loan is paid when the home is sold. Improvements may include wheelchair ramps and grab bars.
site_details: Visit the website and complete the registration form or call to have it mailed. An appointment is scheduled when the completed form is received.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Thurs 10am-7pm
site_eligibility: Living in Marion County -- Needing home modifications for accessibility -- Homeowner must live in the property -- Home must be primary residence

service_description: Offers a low-cost mortgage loan for qualified Marion County homeowners in need of emergency repairs such as a roof, furnace, or other necessities to keep their home habitable. This is a deferred loan with no monthly payment required. Credit reports are not required to qualify.
site_details: Visit the website to complete a registration form or call for assistance. An appointment will be scheduled when the completed form is returned.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Thurs 10am-7pm
site_eligibility: Living in Marion County -- Applicant is owner and occupant of the property -- Meet income eligibility; 80% or below of HUD area median income -- Current with mortgage, property taxes, and homeowner insurance

site_name: INDIANAPOLIS METROPOLITAN POLICE DEPARTMENT - VICTIM ASSISTANCE UNIT
service_description: Provides assistance to persons who have suffered, directly or indirectly, a physical, emotional, or personal loss as a result of a criminal act within the Indianapolis Municipal Police Department (IMPD) district.  Assistance may include on-the-scene crisis intervention, emotional support to victims and their families, referrals to needed services, help filing violent crime compensation forms, and information about victims' rights and obligations.
site_details: Call for assistance or for more information about this unit's services. Note: Advocates respond on the scene to police runs involving homicide, robbery, domestic violence, assaults, sex offenses, child and elder abuse or neglect, suicide, and Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS).
site_eligibility: Victims of a criminal act within the IMPD district

agency_desc: A utility company providing retail electric service to more than 480,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers in Indianapolis and other central Indiana communities.
service_description: Provides customers in Marion County and parts of surrounding counties with electricity. Provides account information, connection/disconnection services, and payment options. Customer service representatives may be able to negotiate payment arrangements to assist customers in crisis situations, either directly or through a social service agency advocating on the client's behalf.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_schedule: Live Customer Service: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Automated Customer Service: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Living in AES service area -- Additional requirements vary by program

agency_desc: A utility company providing retail electric service to more than 480,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers in Indianapolis and other central Indiana communities.
service_description: Provides a free virtual home energy assessment. Advisor will send a link to your smart device to connect with you live and conduct your walk-through assessment discussing findings, your home's current energy efficiency, and recommend additional ways to help you save. After the assessment, you may receive a free energy savings kit with items recommended by your advisor to help you start saving energy right away.
site_details: Call or visit the website to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Current AES residential customers -- Working wifi -- Have not had AES energy assessment within past 3 years

agency_desc: A utility company providing retail electric service to more than 480,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers in Indianapolis and other central Indiana communities.
service_description: Assists the property owner by temporarily shutting off power to the service line so that the tree trimming work can be performed safely.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Power lines within the AES service area

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach including a hot meal program.

site_details: Walk in; enter through the south door, (under the green and white striped awning).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government funded agency providing housing in Marion County to over 7600 families each year through the Low Income Public Housing communities and Section 8 rental programs.
site_name: INDIANAPOLIS HOUSING AGENCY - PUBLIC HOUSING COMMUNITIES
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Marion County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Marion County is currently closed. -- No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families

When wait lists are open, pre-applications can only be submitted online. Only properly completed pre-applications will be added to the wait list. Availability varies by community; closed or long wait lists are common.
site_details: Properties with an OPEN wait list: Visit the website for property details and submit pre-application form online. -- Persons with disability needing help to apply: Call or email for assistance -- NOTE: Only properly completed applications will be added to the wait list. When applicant's name is drawn, they will be contacted by mail to begin the eligibility process.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, long-term residential program for adult males suffering from alcoholism and substance abuse.
service_description: Provides residential treatment and recovery services including housing, meals, a structured recovery program, and mental health resources for men recovering from alcohol or drug addiction. Clients pay a weekly fee. Minimum stay is 90 days; recommended stay is six (6) months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or apply online.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from substance abuse -- Committed to total abstinence from alcohol  and other drugs during stay -- Mentally and physically fit to participate in program -- Submit to frequent, random drug and alcohol screening -- Willing to participate in one's own recovery

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that operates six (6) housing programs that vary from Levels 1-3. Programs serve homeless men trying to overcome addiction and mental illness to help them begin recovery, become financially self-sufficient and begin independent living through placement in permanent housing.
service_description: Offers supportive housing programs for homeless men with substance abuse issues who may or may not have a coexisting mental illness. Programs include entry-level, semi-independent, and permanent affordable housing and are matched to the applicant's needs.

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule pre-admission interview; (application can be printed from website).
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Homeless (without a permanent night-time residence) -- History of alcohol/drug problem -- Willing to accept mental health treatment -- Agree to minimal 6-month stay -- Adhere to all program structure -- Work toward successful discharge

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing food to area residents in need.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in zip code 46221 -- Limit one (1) visit per month

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Suspends driver's licenses due to traffic violations or lack of insurance and reinstates licenses for eligible drivers. Indiana drivers can obtain their driving record, find out the current status of their drivers license and, if suspended, the requirements for reinstatement by visiting the website or calling the Bureau of Motor Vehicles (BMV) Contact Center.
site_details: Visit the website or call for reinstatement eligibility date and requirements, including fees.-- When eligible, request the court send reinstatement papers directly to the BMV. -- Ask insurance provider to electronically submit proof of insurance in the form indicated by the reinstatement requirements. -- Pay reinstatement fees online, by phone, or through the mail (with coupon). -- If physical license was taken away, walk in to nearest license branch to purchase a replacement. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Reinstatement requirements vary based on the circumstances of suspension.

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Suspends driver's licenses due to traffic violations or lack of insurance and reinstates licenses for eligible drivers. Indiana drivers can obtain their driving record, find out the current status of their drivers license and, if suspended, the requirements for reinstatement by visiting the website or calling the Bureau of Motor Vehicles (BMV) Contact Center.
site_details: Visit the website or call for reinstatement eligibility date and requirements, including fees.-- When eligible, request the court send reinstatement papers directly to the BMV. -- Ask insurance provider to electronically submit proof of insurance in the form indicated by the reinstatement requirements. -- Pay reinstatement fees online, by phone, or through the mail (with coupon). -- If physical license was taken away, walk in to nearest license branch to purchase a replacement. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Reinstatement requirements vary based on the circumstances of suspension.

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Enables Indiana residents to title their vehicles. Indiana residents who purchase a vehicle or receive a vehicle as a gift must re-title it in their own name within 31 days. New Indiana residents must title their vehicles in Indiana within 60 days of becoming an Indiana resident.  Indiana residents may also register to vote at a license branch when processing any type of credential transaction.
site_details: Walk in to any branch to title a vehicle. -- Duplicate titles may be ordered online. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Vehicle owner (passenger cars or trucks, motorcycles, farm equipment, watercraft, etc.)

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Offers state identification cards for Indiana residents of any age who do not have a driver's license. New identification cards are mailed to the customers home. Temporary identification cards (acceptable for voting) are provided until the permanent identification card arrives by mail. Nonsecure identification cards (for voting purposes) are also available to individuals who have a valid driver's license or state identification card on file, but who have misplaced them. Indiana residents may also register to vote at a license branch when processing any type of credential transaction.
site_details: New Card: Walk in with required documentation. -- Renewal/Replacement: Walk in, call for appointment, or complete transaction online. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- US citizen or legal resident

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Issues placards that allow holders to park in areas designated for disabled drivers. Placards are available to those with qualifying permanent or temporary disabilities, and to organizations that transport or provide facilities for persons with physical disabilities. Indiana residents may also register to vote at a license branch when processing any type of credential transaction.
site_details: Call or visit website for assistance. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Indiana residents of any age -- With one of the following conditions: Temporary or permanent physical disability that requires the use of a wheelchair, walker, braces, or crutches -- Temporary or permanent loss of the use of one or both legs -- Restricted mobility, either temporary or permanent, due to a pulmonary or cardiovascular disability, arthritic condition, or orthopedic or neurological impairment -- Permanently blindness or visually impairment

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
service_description: Provides learner's permits and driver's licenses to eligible Indiana residents. Offers special licenses for commercial and for-hire drivers, and motorcycle riders. Indiana residents may also register to vote at a license branch when processing any type of credential transaction.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk into a BMV branch for assistance. -- To take a written examination or driving skills test, arrive at least one hour before the branch closes. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call or visit website for details.

agency_desc: The Indiana state agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.

site_details: Call or visit website for assistance. -- Visit https://www.in.gov/bmv/branch-locations-and-hours/bmv-branch-map/ for branch locations.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- With one of the following conditions: A permanent disability that requires the use of a wheelchair, walker, braces, or crutches -- Permanently lost the use of one or both legs -- Restricted mobility due to certain medical conditions -- Permanently blind or visually impaired

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency providing community-focused, full service health care.

service_description: Provides transportation for veterans to Veterans Affairs (VA) medical facilities or VA doctor referred medical facilities outside of the VA system. Recruits and organizes volunteers to provide rides to veterans in need of this service.
site_details: Call to schedule transportation. Service is provided on a first-come first-served basis. A minimum notice of 72 hours is required, seven days is preferred.
site_eligibility: Veterans -- With a medical appointment at a VA medical facility located at the VA medical center or one of the community VA health clinics -OR- With a referral from a VA doctor to an appointment at a medical facility outside of the VA system -- Able to transfer in and out of vehicle without assistance; only small shoulder bag oxygen and concentrators are permitted

site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Pharmacy Call Center: Mon-Fri 7:30am-5pm
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard) -- Their dependents (If deceased) surviving spouse, child, or parent

site_eligibility: Living in Warren Township, Sugar Creek Township, or Buck Creek Township -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_name: RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES OF CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing lodging in a homelike setting for families of children who must travel to Indianapolis for their child's hospitalization at an Indianapolis hospital, primarily Riley Children's Hospital.
site_name: RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES OF CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Provides homelike, temporary lodging for out-of-town families of seriously ill or injured children being treated at Riley and other Indianapolis-area hospitals. Small nightly fee is negotiable. Residents help with household tasks.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply and be placed on waiting list. -- Hospital referrals accepted.
site_eligibility: Families who must travel to Indianapolis to receive medical treatment for their seriously ill or injured child

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering assistance with community development and home purchase assistance, including home repairs.
service_description: Provides programs and services to protect and revitalize the residential and business community within set boundaries on the near southeast side of Indianapolis. Projects vary based on community needs and funding availability and may include owner-occupied home repairs, referrals to housing counseling, and rehabilitation of housing for affordable home ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for specific program intake information.
site_eligibility: Varies; some programs may have income requirements and/or be limited to residents within agency boundaries of N-Washington St.; S-Troy Ave.; E-Emerson Ave.; W-White River

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides domestic violence and sexual assault services.
service_description: Provides financial support education to help victims of domestic violence and sexual assault become self-sufficient in order to financially support themselves and their children. Financial support education includes instruction with computers, typing, resume writing, dressing for success, mock interviews, financial budgeting and assistance with job placement. Also assists survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault with moving from short-term safety to long-term security. Providing them with the knowledge and skills to achieve economic self-sufficiency.
site_details: Call for information or an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Victim or survivor of domestic violence and/or sexual assault

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides domestic violence and sexual assault services.
service_description: Provides safe, temporary care for the pets of domestic violence and sexual assault victims who are actively fleeing abuse. This program is designed to temporarily place pet victims into with foster families for up to 90 days while their owner seeks shelter, works on becoming self-sufficient, and securing permanent housing, and then they are reunited with their beloved pets. Placement is not guaranteed and is based on foster availability.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Actively fleeing abuse and is a victim of domestic violence and/or sexual assault -- In need of temporary placement of pets in order to leave an unsafe home

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides domestic violence and sexual assault services.
service_description: Provides domestic violence prevention education presentations and trainings to community partners and the general public, and empowers victims and survivors. Education is focused on empowering survivors so that patterns are not repeated and repeat abuse is prevented, breaking the cycle of abuse.
site_details: Call for information about program offerings or to request presentations/trainings.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides domestic violence and sexual assault services.
service_name: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT ADVOCACY
service_description: Beacon of Hope Crisis Center advocates provide safety, education, and support to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault. Our advocates are dedicated to providing confidential ongoing case management and advocacy services. Some of those case management and advocacy services include crisis intervention support; court advocacy/criminal justice system support such as assistance in filing protective orders, assistance with a victim impact statement, connecting with the prosecutor's office and/or law enforcement, and education on victim rights; safety planning, employment assistance, advocacy accompaniment for medical, court, and law enforcement, and referrals for emergency shelter, legal assistance, medical assistance, transportation, basic needs, and counseling services.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides domestic violence and sexual assault services.

They can help with protective order filing, safety planning, employment assistance, barrier reduction (transportation, rent), life-skills, referrals for shelter, legal assistance, counseling, etc., and provide services and programs appropriate for specific needs.

They can help with protective order filing, safety planning, employment assistance, barrier reduction (transportation, rent), life-skills, referrals for shelter, legal assistance, counseling, etc., and provide services and programs appropriate for specific needs.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Victim of domestic violence and/or sexual assault

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists volunteers to host homes for families and children in need of crisis child care.
site_name: SAFE FAMILIES FOR CHILDREN - CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Provides crisis and respite care for children whose parents are temporarily unable to care for them due to a short-term emergency, such as hospitalization, or a longer-term crisis, such as drug abuse, incarceration, homelessness, domestic violence, or unemployment. Care is provided in the homes of trained, volunteer host families. Children may stay in a Safe Families home as little as one night or as long as several months.
site_details: Call to begin the intake process. -- Callers will need to explain their family situation and provide each child's medical background and Medicaid number (if applicable). -- Leave a voicemail with family situation and contact information for a return call.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone, Delaware, Hamilton, Hendricks, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Shelby, or Tipton County -- Age 0-18 -- Note: Youth with severe behavioral problems may be screened out.

agency_name: SALVATION ARMY RUTH LILLY WOMEN AND CHILDREN'S CENTER
agency_desc: A Christian-based, nonprofit agency, the Salvation Army Service Center provides a safe place for homeless and abused women and children.
site_name: SALVATION ARMY RUTH LILLY WOMEN AND CHILDREN'S CENTER
service_description: Provides shelter for victims of domestic violence. Support services include legal assistance, domestic abuse support groups, on-site child care, assistance with finding housing, life-skills training, employment information, literacy classes, basic health care, substance abuse classes, and voluntary spiritual counseling. Families stay in a shared room; single women in semi-private accommodations. Male victims with children may be admitted, but space is extremely limited. Intake available 24 hours per day. Maximum stay is 45 days or as determined by casework plan. Open service area.
site_details: Call to determine availability of space and complete intake assessment
site_eligibility: Women (with or without children)   -OR- Men who are actively fleeing (with or without children) -- Seeking shelter due to domestic abuse or violence -- Ages 18 and older, or legally emancipated -- With legal guardianship of any accompanying children (children up to 24 years old)

agency_name: SALVATION ARMY RUTH LILLY WOMEN AND CHILDREN'S CENTER

site_name: SALVATION ARMY RUTH LILLY WOMEN AND CHILDREN'S CENTER
service_description: Provides shelter for pregnant women, and women with or without children. Includes three meals per day and support services such as on-site child care, employment information, assistance with finding housing, legal assistance, basic health care, and parenting, literacy and substance abuse classes. Maximum stay is 45 days or as determined by casework plan.
site_details: Call to see if space is available and, if so, for intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Women -- Ages 18 and older (or legally emancipated  ) -- With or without children (children up to 18, if still in school) -- Have not stayed at this shelter within the past 90 days

service_description: Provides emergency bed space, for any person who is fleeing domestic violence, when all other shelters are full. Candidates for this program must be eligible for domestic violence shelter in accordance with Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence guidelines.
site_details: After contacting all other shelters, Navigators may call and specifically request the "Emergency Bed Space Plan" and connect client for an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Persons fleeing domestic abuse -- Adult men and women, emancipated minors, or identify as LGBT -- With or without children (up to age 17) -- Not in need of nursing care -- Not a danger to self or others -- Have not been previously dismissed from shelter for jeopardizing safety of staff or clients -- All other shelter options have been exhausted

site_schedule: Registration: Aug 18 - Oct 7, 2023 -- Distribution: Oct 14, 2023: Sat 8am-2pm
site_eligibility: Children, age 17 or younger -OR- still enrolled in high school -- Children must be present to receive a coat -- Must register

Community partners also offer growth opportunities, including skills training and mentorships.
site_details: Call or visit website to apply.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: SOCIETY OF SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL - INDIANAPOLIS
agency_desc: A Catholic lay organization offering person-to-person service to those who are needy and suffering, in the tradition of its founder, Blessed Frederic Ozanam, and patron, Saint Vincent de Paul.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL - DISTRIBUTION CENTER
service_description: Provides donated furniture, new mattresses/frames, bed linens, clothing (see clothing program), appliances, and other household goods free of charge to persons in need. Assistance is determined by home assessment. Supplies vary by donations received and all items are on an as-available basis. Household is required to transport their items.
site_details: Call the helpline to speak with a volunteer to schedule a home needs assessment (DO NOT leave a message). -OR- Visit the website to complete an online help form by clicking, "I need help". -- A volunteer will call back to arrange a home visit for needs assessment. -- Approved households are then referred to neighbor services to schedule the pick up of needed items.
site_eligibility: Living in Marion County and surrounding donut counties.

Furniture and appliance pick-up service can be scheduled.
site_details: Bring items to the distribution center during drop-off hours. -- To schedule a pick-up, fill out the online Donation Form or call the donation line. Allow a 1-2 week window.
site_schedule: Drop-off: Mon-Sat 8am-4pm at the South Dock 1201 E. Maryland Street -- Clothing donations can also be delivered to any of their clothing bins (see website for locations) -- Pick-up: Varies
site_eligibility:
Drop-off: Open -- 
Donation pick-up: Includes Marion County and surrounding counties.

Community members: Call or complete the online help form on the website to schedule a home assessment; must speak with a person, do not leave a message.

site_schedule: Scheduling: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Spanish Line: Mon-Fri 9:30am-12:30pm -- Store hours: Visit www.mission27resale.org
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government umbrella agency that provides support services to other state agencies to help assure the smooth functioning of state government.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF CHILD SERVICES OMBUDSMAN BUREAU
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve complaints concerning actions of the Department of Child Services (DCS). Persons should first attempt to resolve their complaint directly with their family case manager, his or her supervisor, and/or the local office director. This bureau operates independently of the Department of Child Services.
site_details: Complaints must be filed in writing. -- Download complaint form from the website or call the Ombudsman Information Line to have one mailed. -- To speak directly with the ombudsman, call and leave contact information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government umbrella agency that provides support services to other state agencies to help assure the smooth functioning of state government.

agency_desc: A government umbrella agency that provides support services to other state agencies to help assure the smooth functioning of state government.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS OMBUDSMAN BUREAU
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve complaints from offenders housed in Department of Corrections (DOC) facilities or their family members, alleging that the department either (1) violated a specific law, rule, or department written policy; or (2) endangered the health or safety of a person. The name of the individual filing the complaint will not be disclosed without his/her permission, except to the extent necessary to investigate and resolve the complaint.
site_details: The Ombudsman Bureau Complaint Form must be used for all complaints. -- These forms are available in the law library of each DOC facility or can be downloaded from the website. -- Call the bureau for information; offenders can use JPAY (kiosk in facility) to email request for information at no cost.
site_eligibility: Open

site_eligibility: Indiana businesses and start-ups that are at least 51% owned and controlled by women, veterans, or minorities.

agency_desc: A faith-based home for recovering alcoholic men.
service_description: Provides a residential facility for men who are recovering alcoholics or recovering drug addicts. Residents attend Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), Narcotics Anonymous (NA), and Cocaine Anonymous (CA) meetings that are held on the premises. Normal length of stay is six months; dorm style living.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for initial interview.
site_eligibility: Adult males -- Recovering alcoholics or drug abusers; no exceptions

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Provides food each month to low-income seniors in Marion County, including high-protein items, grains, vegetables, fruit, juices, and shelf-stable milk. The program strives to provide application/pick-up locations convenient to participants. Participants must be re-certified every annually in person and every 6 months by phone if nothing has changed. Participants may arrange for a proxy to pick up the food packages on their behalf. Delivery is not available.
site_details: Call to submit application.
site_eligibility: Ages 60 or older -- Current household income at or below 130% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Provides information, referral, and options counseling for seniors and persons of any age with disabilities. Trained specialists answer questions about issues such as nutrition, transportation, medical equipment, health care, support services, and government benefit programs.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Persons of any age with physical disabilities and their caretakers

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Offers a voucher program that enables older adults to have more options and increased flexibility in their dining choices. For a suggested contribution seniors can receive a reusable meal card that may be redeemed at participating cafeterias and restaurants for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. May receive up to eight vouchers per month. Some enrollment sites may have waitlist; program is first come, first served.
site_details: Visit https://cicoa.org/services/senior-meals-nutrition/meal-vouchers/ for locations. -- Call or visit an enrollment site to setup your senior discount meal card.
site_schedule: CICOA Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Enrollment Site: Available by location
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

service_description: Provides pet supplies to Marion County seniors in need. Supplies include dry dog and cat food, wet food, cat litter, training pads, leashes, and carriers.
site_details: Call to complete application.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CARE AWARE: A CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICE OF CICOA
service_description: Provides information and services to caregivers, including resource material, an on-line video series, counseling, workshops, and referrals to respite services. Information and resources are also available to assist grandparents, age 55 or older, who are raising grandchildren under age 18.
site_details: Call for information. -- Visit https://cicoa.org/services/caregiver-support/contact/ to apply for a referral.
site_eligibility: Caregivers, including grandparents over 55 caring for minors

service_description: Offers seniors checks to be redeemed at state-approved farmers markets in the CICOA service area, valid August, September, and October yearly.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Visit https://cicoa.org/services/senior-meals-nutrition/farmers-market-checks/ to download application. -- Completed applications can be mailed, faxed, or emailed.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- 55 or older, disabled, and living in senior housing with congregate nutrition services.

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Provides various transportation to medical appointments, grocery shopping, pharmacy, etc. to persons age 60 and older in Marion County. Travel must be within Marion County. Transportation available on a first-come, first-served basis.
site_details: To Enroll: Call for an application or visit website to apply online or to print an application. Return applications by mail, email, fax, or drop off at the CICOA office. If someone other than the consumer will be scheduling trips, a Proxy Form authorizing this representative must be completed. -- Appointments may be scheduled 30 days in advance. -- Way2Go’s fleet of vehicles can provide both ambulatory and wheelchair transports, as requested.
site_eligibility: Living in Marion County -- Age 60 or older -- Requiring travel within Marion County

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Delivers regular, low sodium or diabetic-diet frozen meals bi-weekly.  Meals must be paid for two weeks in advance to begin delivery. Meals can can be ordered in 2,3,4,5,7 or 10 packs. Delivery times vary.
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Serves as the access point to connect persons age 60 and older, and persons with disabilities to human services. Area Agencies on Aging are responsible for coordinating, planning, and funding person-centered home- and community-based services, which may include: advocacy, case management, and health care coordination, comprehensive information and referral, congregate and home-delivered meals, government subsidies issued for assisted living options, and transportation services.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Persons of any age with physical disabilities and their caregivers

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Vlll), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waiver and Indiana CHOICE. Ongoing person-centered case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to provide a stipend (not pay) to family caregivers.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information, referral and advocacy for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families.
service_description: Provides a means to establish a trust fund to provide for the future financial needs of someone with a disability, without affecting that person's eligibility for government programs such as Supplemental Security Income (SSI) or Medicaid. Trust I allows families to set up a trust fund for a loved one with disabilities; Trust II allows people with disabilities to fund their own trust.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Persons wanting to establish a special needs trust for a family member with a disability and persons with disabilities wanting to establish their own trust.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering comprehensive behavioral health care for all ages.
site_name: ADULT AND CHILD - MADISON AVENUE - INDIANAPOLIS
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

site_eligibility: Age 5 or older

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.

agency_desc: A government agency that promotes the welfare of the wage earners, job seekers, and retirees of the United States.
service_description: Offers a full-time education and job-training program. Business technology and certified nursing assistant (CNA) programs are available, as well as high school diploma assistance (if needed), career planning, and life-skills classes. Participants receive a basic living allowance, health and dental care, a daily meal, bus passes, and transitional assistance upon graduation. Length of participation is generally 8-24 months. This is not a residential program.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- National Recruitment Hotline: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens or legally able to work in the United States

site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- National Recruitment Hotline: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens or legally able to work in the United States

agency_desc: A government agency that promotes the welfare of the wage earners, job seekers, and retirees of the United States.
site_name: EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION-  OF APPRENTICESHIP - CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Offers apprentice programs in the building trades, manufacturing, and other service occupations in the private sector. Programs last 1-5 years and include paid, on-the-job training. Wages begin at approximately 50% of the fully trained journeyman rate and increase periodically.
site_details: Call or visit website for a list of available apprenticeship programs.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Age 16 or older (18 and older for hazardous occupations -- With HSE (GED) or high school diploma (limited number of employers may allow completion after apprenticeship begins)

agency_desc: A government agency that promotes the welfare of the wage earners, job seekers, and retirees of the United States.
site_name: WAGE AND HOUR DIVISION- UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF LABOR - INDIANAPOLIS DISTRICT
service_description: Provides information about the federal minimum wage, overtime pay, wage garnishment, child labor restrictions, the Family Medical Leave Act, federal contract prevailing wages, the use of lie detection equipment in the workplace, immigrant worker laws, and migrant farm worker protections. This agency enforces federal labor laws; it does not provide job-placement services.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - INDIANAPOLIS FIELD
service_description: Handles scheduled interviews on non-asylum-related immigration applications. Most applications can be filed online or by mail. Appointments can be scheduled for the local office for applications or petitions that require in-person filing.
site_details: Call the National Customer Service Center or use the online INFOPASS (infopass.uscis.gov) to schedule an appointment. (Appointments are required for in-person visits or to speak with a local Immigration Information Officer.)
site_schedule: National Customer Service Center: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Indianapolis Field Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri by appointment only
site_eligibility: Filing a USCIS form that requires a visit to the local field office

agency_desc: Western Governors University is a nonprofit online university founded and supported by 19 US governors and regionally accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities.
service_description: Offers undergraduate and graduate degree and licensure programs. Western Governors University is a nonprofit online university.
site_details: Call or visit website to apply. Transcripts from previous colleges/universities are required.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm; Sat 8am-5pm -- Student Support Center: Mon-Fri 6am-10pm; Sat 7am-7pm
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- With a Social Security or Permanent Resident card -- Have earned a high school diploma or equivalency certificate -- Program-specific admissions requirements may apply

agency_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services for foster parenting, adoption and family preservation and reunification.
site_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH (SAFY) - INDIANAPOLIS
service_description: Recruits and trains eligible persons to become foster parents. Provides placement and support services for foster parents.
site_details: Call to request an information packet or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Live in Marion, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, or Shelby County - Age 21 or older -- Able to pass extensive background checks, participate in all required training, and provide a safe home environment

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
site_name: INDIANAPOLIS VET CENTER- VETERANS HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
service_description: Offers a peer support program using reintegration counseling to help combat veterans and their families cope with stress, transition into civilian life, and reduce barriers to care. Services include individual, marriage, and family counseling, bereavement and military sexual trauma (MST) counseling, and referrals.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or walk in during regular business hours; call to make an after hours or weekend appointment
site_eligibility: United States combat war veterans and their immediate families

service_description: Offers grants for veterans with severe, service-connected disabilities who require enhanced home accessibility. Funds may be used to build or remodel the home for accessibility.
site_details: Visit the website, send an email, or call the program office for more information. -- Applications may be obtained and submitted in person, by mail, or online.
site_eligibility: US veterans and service members -- With a permanent and total service-connected disability due to one of the following:   - Loss (or loss of use) of both arms and/or legs, or combination of that effects mobility,  or   - Blindness in both eyes or only light perception, or   - Certain severe burns, or   - Certain severe respiratory injuries

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
service_description: Provides information to veterans or their surviving spouses and dependents regarding federal benefits. Administers nonmedical veterans' services, including disability compensation, guardianship, and burial and death payments.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application for benefits.
site_eligibility: Open -- US veterans, their surviving spouses and children

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
service_description: Provides information and assistance to help veterans and/or their surviving spouses avoid foreclosure. In the case of VA-guaranteed home loans, the loan technician may take an active role in interceding with the servicer to explore all options to avoid foreclosure. In the case of non-VA guaranteed home loans, the loan technician may still be able to provide information and guidance, but does not have the legal authority to intervene on the borrowers behalf. In all cases, it is important for the client to contact his/her lender as quickly as possible to explore options to avoid foreclosure.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Veterans or their surviving spouses -- Encountering problems making mortgage payments

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
service_description: Provides rehabilitation and job retraining to veterans who are disabled. After initial application (VA28-1900), those whose service-related disability is rated 10% or higher may be eligible for services.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application, or apply online.
site_eligibility: Open --  US veterans who are currently serving or discharged (other than dishonorable) -- With a service-connected disability rating of at least 10%, or a memorandum rating of   20% or more from the Department of Veteran Affairs (VA)

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
service_name: NATIONAL CALL CENTER FOR HOMELESS VETERANS
service_description: Provides homeless veterans and veterans at risk for homelessness with free, 24-hour access to trained counselors. Provides veterans, their families, and advocates with information about local Veterans Affairs (VA) homeless programs and mental health services.
site_details: Call for information and assistance.
site_eligibility: Veterans and their families who are homeless or facing homelessness (or others calling on their behalf)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a twelve step program to help the family and friends of alcoholics, including Alateen which offers a group for teens living with the effects of a parent's or other relative's problem drinking.
site_name: AL-ANON FAMILY GROUP - INDIANAPOLIS INFORMATION SERVICES
service_description: Offers support groups for friends and relatives of alcoholics, following the 12-Step model. Al-Anon is for adults; Alateen is for adolescents. Information about meeting times and locations is available by phone or online. Meetings are on a walk-in basis.
taxonomy_name: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
nameLevel5: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
site_details: Walk in, call or visit the website to confirm meeting schedule. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Call or visit the website to confirm meeting schedule. Some meetings may be offered through zoom or Al-Anon Family Groups App.
site_schedule: Live Operator Assistance: Daily 24 hours -- Office literature sales Mon and Thurs 11am-3pm -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Al-Anon: Adult friends or relatives of someone who abuses alcohol -- Alateen: Adolescence, age 13-19 years-old, friends or relatives of someone who abuses alcohol. -- If there are no Alateen meetings locally, teenagers are welcome in an Al-Anon meeting.

agency_desc: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to persons in need. Specialized bedside alarms for individuals who are deaf or hard-of-hearing may also be available. Volunteers will conduct a home assessment, install necessary alarms, and assist households in formulating an escape plan for use in a fire.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana

agency_desc: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.
service_description: Provides general information related to flood conditions, restrictions and support services. This number is not meant for emergency calls. Callers should call 211 in case of emergency.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Living in State of Indiana -- Affected by flooding

agency_desc: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.
service_description: Provides emergency financial assistance to persons affected by major and single-family disasters. Funds may be used for basic needs (such as shelter, clothing, and food) that are the immediate result of a natural or man-made disaster.
site_details: Call the local office during normal business hours; for after-hours emergency calls, use the toll free, 24-hour number. -- The agency will then conduct an assessment and seek verification, such as ordering a fire report or contacting a landlord.
site_schedule: Disaster Relief Intake: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm
site_eligibility: People whose basic needs are not being met as an immediate result of a natural or man-made disaster (including house fires, floods, tornados, etc.)

service_description: Helps individuals make contact and communicate with loved ones separated by war, natural disaster, and civil disturbances. Also works with family members to learn the fate of persons missing as a result of the Holocaust.
site_details: Call for information or to begin a search.
site_eligibility: Families separated as a result of either armed conflict or disaster -- Normal channels of communication have been exhausted -- Person making the inquiry can provide essential information on the sought person -- Person making the inquiry is a close family relative who has been in direct   contact with the sought person before the conflict or disaster occurred (Exceptions to the above may be made in the case of Holocaust inquiries.)
